step.cmd: Open the Data Sources page, by clicking the Data Sources icon in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The Data Sources page opens showing all defined data categories.

step.cmd: Click the New Data Source button.
step.info: The New Data Source screen opens with the Data Policy tab showing.

chdesc.p: Mandatory. A descriptive name for the data source. Numbers, letters, spaces, hyphens, and the underscore character are supported.
chdesc.note: Once you save a data source, the name cannot be edited. To change the name, you must delete the whole data source and reconfigure it with the new name.

chrow.chdesc: Mandatory. The data category of the data source. Choose from the drop-down list of data categories. How do I define data categories?
Mandatory. The individual responsible overall for data stored in . The user must have a role of . Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.

Mandatory. The individual responsible for defining the organization's governance policy and for approving access policies. The user must have a role of . Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.
Mandatory. The individual responsible for approving dataset requests involving this data source. The user must have a role of . Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.
Optional. The data visibility privacy tag to be associated with this data source. Select from the list of configured data visibilities. You can select multiple items by holding down the Shift key.
Optional. The kinds of document expected from this data source. Examples are Microsoft Word, Excel, or JSON.
Optional. A brief description of the kinds of documents expected from this data source.
Optional. Any additional notes for the data source.

step.info: The data sharing agreement records permission for this data to reside on . Click the Choose File button and navigate to the document. Select the document and click Choose. The system uploads the document.Specify tperiod during which this data sharing agreement is in effect. The format for the start and end dates is mm-dd-yyyy.

step.cmd: Specify the retention rules. These rules are used to determine how long each item from this data source can remain in the system.

chdesc.p: Specifies how the retention period is calculated. Supported values are as follows:

ul.li: Retain for a time period. Keeps the data for the period specified. Specify some number of minutes, hours, days, weeks or years.
Delete after time period. Erases the data after the specified time period. Specify some number of minutes, hours, days, weeks or years.

step.cmd: Click the Save Data Source button to save the data policy. When the data policy has been successfully saved, the Data Processing Function and Ingest Data tabs become available on the data source information screen.
